page.title: 10A TYPICAL FARM IN RYTON
page.content: A typical farm in this area was Eat Farm, Barlow. Mr Philipson's family have owned the farm for 45 years but Mr Philipson has only been running it for about 25 years. He owns 30 acres of woodland and farms 226 acres of arable land which is divided up into 20 fields, most of which are given up for rough grazing. 80 acres are used for crops such as barley, turnips and potatoes. These are used to help feed the cattle and the suplus is sold. He has 46 dairy cows which give 200 gallons of milk a day. Mr Philipson has 3 people to help him.
